comments:
In code like this, stepping into the "put" generates an exception:

 Map<String, Integer> map = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
 map.put("one", 2);

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1093)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDILocalVariable.getReferenceTypeName
(JDILocalVariable.java:109)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getVariableText
(JDIModelPresentation.java:1139)

(JDIModelPresentation.java:211)

(LazyModelPresentation.java:156)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DelegatingModelPresentation.getText
(DelegatingModelPresentation.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.VariablesViewModelPresentation.getText

(DebugViewLabelDecorator.java:323)

I get a similar exception when I expand an ArrayList<String> in the variables 
view.

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -2
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1768)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIFieldVariable.getReferenceTypeName
(JDIFieldVariable.java:193)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getVariableText
(JDIModelPresentation.java:1139)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getText
(JDIModelPresentation.java:211)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.LazyModelPresentation.getText
(LazyModelPresentation.java:156)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DelegatingModelPresentation.getText
(DelegatingModelPresentation.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.VariablesViewModelPresentation.getText
(VariablesViewModelPresentation.java:25)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.DebugViewLabelDecorator$LabelJob.run
(DebugViewLabelDecorator.java:323)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Fixed.
Was a result of the fix for bug 84392. The prevouis fix was not handling the
case when the generic signature contains the info about a type parameter.
Created a new method that correctly generates a name from any generic type
signature, and keeps the '$'s too.

JDIReferenceType - added a method that generates a name from a generic type name.
JDILocalVariable, JDIFieldVariable - updated to use the new method.
